entry.title: Money Musk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Thomas Jefferson and Henry Ford both took an interest in the folk tune and contra dance "Money Musk" (example pictured)?

entry.title: Jacquet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the classic board game Jacquet was the benchmark for all tables games in France during the 19th century?

entry.title: Charles Larson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Charles Larson became one of the first Americans to teach African literature, after working in Nigeria for the Peace Corps to avoid the Vietnam draft?

entry.title: Alpha Phi Beta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Filipino fraternity Alpha Phi Beta has been involved in instances of violence, including getting mauled by rival fraternities, such as Sigma Rho?

entry.title: John Boyden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after he died in September 2021, John Boyden was revealed to have written under the pseudonym "Lunchtime O'Boulez"?

entry.title: Junk Head (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a short version of the Japanese stop motion film Junk Head was favorably reviewed by director Guillermo del Toro?

entry.title: Philinopsis depicta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the sea slug Philinopsis depicta has no radula or jaws, and is thought to protrude its foregut and suck up its prey whole?

entry.title: Pauline Bart (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to American sociologist Pauline Bart, "everything is data, but data isn't everything"?
